ranked_diseases.explanation: Pitt-Hopkins Syndrome is characterized by intellectual disability, autistic behavior, developmental delay, facial dysmorphism such as a triangular face, and microcephaly.
FoxG1 Syndrome features include intellectual disability, autistic-like behavior, motor delay, microcephaly, and distinctive facial features like anteverted nares.
This syndrome is associated with intellectual disability, behavioral disorders similar to autism, speech delay, and distinct facial features.
Cornelia de Lange Syndrome presents with intellectual disability, developmental delay, microcephaly, and characteristic facial dysmorphism.
Features of Rett Syndrome include intellectual disability, autistic behaviors, delayed speech, and motor delays. Anteverted nares and microcephaly can also be present.
